#cloud-config

#v1.0
#Created two user accounts for the server admins. Automatically adds public keys for connection and provides passwordless
#sudo access. The configuration also edits the sshd_config file to prevent root ssh access and allows ssh access from the two # users

    - name: gov
      ssh-authorized-keys:
          - ssh-rsa  govind.suresh1@gmail.com
      sudo: ['ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL']
      groups: sudo
      shell: /bin/bash

    - name: neel
      ssh-authorized-keys:
          - ssh-ed25519 AAAAC3NzaC1lZDI1NTE5AAAAIEL77BGUTC78fLo/kvSrVDkJ/KPvJA7m2wHGTq7ACd/w
      sudo: ['ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL']
      groups: sudo
      shell: /bin/bash

write_files:
    - path: /etc/ssh/sshd_config
      content: |
          Port 4444
          Protocol 2
          HostKey /etc/ssh/ssh_host_rsa_key
          HostKey /etc/ssh/ssh_host_dsa_key
          HostKey /etc/ssh/ssh_host_ecdsa_key
          HostKey /etc/ssh/ssh_host_ed25519_key
          UsePrivilegeSeparation yes
          KeyRegenerationInterval 3600
          ServerKeyBits 1024
          SyslogFacility AUTH
          LogLevel INFO
          LoginGraceTime 120
          PermitRootLogin no
          StrictModes yes
          RSAAuthentication yes
          PubkeyAuthentication yes
          IgnoreRhosts yes
          RhostsRSAAuthentication no
          HostbasedAuthentication no
          PermitEmptyPasswords no
          ChallengeResponseAuthentication no
          X11Forwarding yes
          X11DisplayOffset 10
          PrintMotd no
          PrintLastLog yes
          TCPKeepAlive yes
          AcceptEnv LANG LC_*
          Subsystem sftp /usr/lib/openssh/sftp-server
          UsePAM yes
          AllowUsers [gov, neel]
